title: 115_hr4865
content:
The "Crop Insurance Modernization Act of 2018" may be cited as the short title for this Act. Amendments to the Federal Crop Insurance Act are included in this legislation. (a) Definition of Beginning Farmer or Rancher amended to extend the qualifying period to 10 crop years. 
(b) Management of Corporation updated to include a nonvoting ex officio member who is either the Chief of the Natural Resources Conservation Service or an expert on conservation activities and farm production. 
(c) Collection and Sharing of Information expanded to include risks related to natural resources in the data sharing process. In the Federal Crop Insurance Act, amendments are made to cover crop termination requirements, emphasizing good farming practices and conservation. The changes also focus on understanding the impact of soil type, quality, and conservation practices on risk rating. The amendments to the Federal Crop Insurance Act emphasize good farming practices and conservation activities, including cover crop termination and management. The definition of 'cover crop termination' is clarified as a practice historically resulting in the targeted cover crop's termination. The Federal Crop Insurance Act amendments focus on promoting good farming practices and conservation activities, such as cover crop termination and management. The act includes provisions for an ombudsperson in the Corporation to assist producers with understanding claim denials, rights in denied claims, obtaining rule clarifications, and other duties as determined by the Secretary. The Federal Crop Insurance Act is amended to include research and development activities for a paperwork reduction policy aimed at operations with less than $1,000,000 in revenue. Additionally, a report on beginning farmer barriers is required to be submitted. The Federal Crop Insurance Act is amended to include research and development activities for a paperwork reduction policy for operations with less than $1,000,000 in revenue. A report on beginning farmer barriers in accessing crop insurance, including recommendations to address those barriers, is required to be submitted. Additionally, a report on the expansion of revenue policy availability for the 10 most widely grown crops by acreage is mandated. The Federal Crop Insurance Act is amended to include a Conservation Practice-Based Pilot Program providing premium subsidies to eligible producers in 6 states with high loss ratios. The pilot program will expire no earlier than 5 years after enactment. The Conservation Practice-Based Pilot Program under the Federal Crop Insurance Act provides premium subsidies to eligible producers in high loss counties who commit to conservation practices for at least 5 years. The Corporation will publish reports evaluating producer yield records and program success at 1, 3, and 5 years after enactment. Amendments to the Food Security Act of 1985. Amendments to the Food Security Act of 1985 include conducting annual spot checks on farms for compliance and modifying conservation plans to include ephemeral gully control. The revised plan must be implemented within 1 year. Producers are prohibited from allowing ephemeral gullies to become classic gullies to avoid treatment. The Corporation cannot use production records from one parcel of land to establish history on another parcel.
